top_categories.workout_context: 64ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
Muck n Mac Fest's UK Scotland, British gravel forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 55 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Muck n Mac Fest's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before May.
At Muck n Mac Fest, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Muck n Mac Fest. Train it until it feels boring.
When someone attacks on uK Scotland gravel, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Muck n Mac Fest, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
55 miles on uK Scotland gravel burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
Varied gradients on uK Scotland gravel demand climbing versatility. Sit the shallow stuff, stand the steep stuff, switch without thinking.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on uK Scotland gravel. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.
Low-cadence force work for 3,500ft of climbing. The slow, grinding ascents where you can't spin—you push.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Muck n Mac Fest’s 55 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Muck n Mac Fest requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on uk scotland gravel to build confidence. Expect: uk scotland, british gravel, uk.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 55 miles of uk scotland gravel in Traquair House, Scotland, UK.
